Package ohos.media.player

Interface Player.IPlayerCallback

  • Enclosing class:
    Player

    public static interface Player.IPlayerCallback
    Provides media player callbacks upon completion of playback, playback position changes, and video size changes.
    Since:
    3
    See Also:
    Player.setPlayerCallback(IPlayerCallback)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void onBufferingChange​(int percent)
      Called when the buffering percentage updates.
      void onError​(int errorType, int errorCode)
      Called when a player error message is received.
      void onMediaTimeIncontinuity​(Player.MediaTimeInfo info)
      Called when the media time continuity is broken, for example, when an error occurs during the playback, the playback position is changed by Player.rewindTo(long), or the playback speed changes suddenly.
      void onMessage​(int type, int extra)
      Called when a player message or alarm is received.
      void onNewTimedMetaData​(Player.MediaTimedMetaData data)
      Called when there is new timed metadata available.
      void onPlayBackComplete​()
      Called when the playback is complete.
      void onPrepared​()
      Called when the media file is ready for playback.
      void onResolutionChanged​(int width, int height)
      Called when the video size changes.
      void onRewindToComplete​()
      Called when the playback position is changed by Player.rewindTo(long).

    • Method Detail

      • onPrepared

        void onPrepared​()
        Called when the media file is ready for playback.
        Since:
        3

      • onMessage

        void onMessage​(int type,
               int extra)
        Called when a player message or alarm is received.
        Parameters:
        type - Indicates the message type, which can be one of the following:
        • Player.PLAYER_INFO_UNKNOWN
        • Player.PLAYER_INFO_VIDEO_TRACK_LAGGING
        • Player.PLAYER_INFO_VIDEO_RENDERING_START
        • Player.PLAYER_INFO_BUFFERING_START
        • Player.PLAYER_INFO_BUFFERING_END
        • Player.PLAYER_INFO_NETWORK_BANDWIDTH
        • Player.PLAYER_INFO_BAD_INTERLEAVING
        • Player.PLAYER_INFO_NOT_SEEKABLE
        • Player.PLAYER_INFO_METADATA_UPDATE
        • Player.PLAYER_INFO_UNSUPPORTED_SUBTITLE
        • Player.PLAYER_INFO_SUBTITLE_TIMED_OUT
        extra - Indicates the extra code for the message type. The meaning is subject to the implementation.
        Since:
        3

      • onError

        void onError​(int errorType,
             int errorCode)
        Called when a player error message is received.
        Parameters:
        errorType - Indicates the error type, which can be one of the following:
        • Player.PLAYER_ERROR_UNKNOWN
        • Player.PLAYER_ERROR_SERVER_DIED
        errorCode - Indicates the error code, which can be one of the following:
        • Player.PLAYER_ERROR_IO
        • Player.PLAYER_ERROR_MALFORMED
        • Player.PLAYER_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED
        • Player.PLAYER_ERROR_TIMED_OUT
        • Player.PLAYER_ERROR_SYSTEM
        Since:
        3

      • onResolutionChanged

        void onResolutionChanged​(int width,
                         int height)
        Called when the video size changes.
        Parameters:
        width - Indicates the video width.
        height - Indicates the video height.
        Since:
        3

      • onPlayBackComplete

        void onPlayBackComplete​()
        Called when the playback is complete.
        Since:
        3

      • onRewindToComplete

        void onRewindToComplete​()
        Called when the playback position is changed by Player.rewindTo(long).
        Since:
        3

      • onBufferingChange

        void onBufferingChange​(int percent)
        Called when the buffering percentage updates. The percentage indicates how much data has been buffered, for example, 80 means that 80% of the content has been buffered.
        Parameters:
        percent - Indicates the media stream buffering percentage. The value ranges from 0 to 100.
        Since:
        3

      • onNewTimedMetaData

        void onNewTimedMetaData​(Player.MediaTimedMetaData data)
        Called when there is new timed metadata available.
        Parameters:
        data - Indicates the information about timed metadata .
        Since:
        3

      • onMediaTimeIncontinuity

        void onMediaTimeIncontinuity​(Player.MediaTimeInfo info)
        Called when the media time continuity is broken, for example, when an error occurs during the playback, the playback position is changed by Player.rewindTo(long), or the playback speed changes suddenly.
        Parameters:
        info - Indicates the time information.
        Since:
        3
